Detailed Description

An abstract item-renderer is used for rendering the items of any GUI-component. The renderer defines the position, size, look and animation-behavior of the item-icon and item-text.

Usually an icon of an item is represented by an APOXI-bitmap, which allows a fast drawing. But the icon may also be represented by complex image-formats like JPEG, GIF or PNG. To avoid that the item-renderer has to implement the complex rendering and animation of such images, this must be done inside the GUI-component itself by using an ImageBox, which does the rendering inside a separate thread.

The rendering and animation of the item-text must be done by the item-renderer itself.

A GUI-component using a renderer should provide the following points:

  • Obtain the renderer in Component::Refresh by invoking renderer = GuiEngineConfig::ObtainItemRenderer(renderer_properties)
  • Release the renderer in Component::Cleanup by invoking GuiEngineConfig::ReleaseItemRenderer(renderer)
  • Provide a timer, which uses the properties of the renderer as delay and triggers AbstractItemRenderer::ScrollText and AbstractItemRenderer::StartTextScrolling.
  • If the icon is represented by an image, it is recommended to use an ImageBox for the drawing (if the icon is represented by a bitmap, the renderer does the drawing automatically).

See also:
Item

AbstractItemGrid

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum AbstractItemRenderer::ItemStyle
 

Defines the style of the item. The item style is passed as input parameter in the methods AbstractItemRenderer::DrawBackground and AbstractItemRenderer::DrawItem.

Enumerator:
DefaultStyle  Default style. Usually animations are not handled by this style.
SelectedStyle  Style for selected items. Usually animations are handled by this style. The style is used for the selected item inside lists and menus.
HeaderStyle  Items which are part of a header. For example it is possible to define header item inside lists and menus. Usually animations are not handled by this style.
AnimatedStyle  Is like the default style, but animations are handled by this style.
CustomStyle  Values above 100 can be used for custom styles.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void AbstractItemRenderer::DrawBackground (  DeviceContext *  dc,
const Item &  item,
const Rect &  bounds,
INT  item_style
)  const [pure virtual]
 

The drawing of an item is done in 3 steps: 1. draw the item-background by AbstractItemRenderer::DrawBackground 2. draw the item-icon, if it is an image 3. draw the item by AbstractItemRenderer::DrawItem

DrawBackground draws the background of each item. Usually the background of an item having another item-style (indicated by the parameter item_style) is done in a different color. Per default the whole grid-background is filled with the background-color defined in the ItemRendererProperties.

Parameters:
dc Device-context where the drawing is done.
item The item which will be drawn above the background.
bounds The bounding-rectangle where the drawing of the background must be done. It is not allowed to do any drawing outside this rectangle.
item_style Specifies the style of the item (see ItemStyle).

Implemented in AtlItemRenderer, and DefaultItemRenderer.

virtual void AbstractItemRenderer::DrawItem (  DeviceContext *  dc,
const Item &  item,
const Rect &  bounds,
INT  item_style
)  const [pure virtual]
 

The drawing of an item is done in 3 steps: 1. draw the item-background by AbstractItemRenderer::DrawBackground 2. draw the item-icon, if it is an image 3. draw the item by AbstractItemRenderer::DrawItem

DrawItem draws the item itself. The icon is drawn too if it is represented by a bitmap. If the icon is an image, the control using the renderer must draw this image itself by embedding an image-box.

Parameters:
dc Device-context where the drawing is done.
item The item which should be drawn.
bounds The bounding-rectangle where the drawing of the item must be done. It is not allowed to do any drawing outside this rectangle.
item_style Specifies the style of the item (see ItemStyle).

Implemented in AtlItemRenderer, and DefaultItemRenderer.

virtual Rect AbstractItemRenderer::GetIconRect (  const Item &  item,
const Rect &  bounds
)  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the icon-rectangle where the item-grid does the drawing of the item-icon. The icon-rectangle must be inside the rectangle defined by bounds.

Parameters:
item Item which contains the icon that should be drawn.
bounds bounding-rectangle of the area where the drawing of the whole item should be done.

Implemented in AtlItemRenderer, and DefaultItemRenderer.

IconState::Size AbstractItemRenderer::GetIconSizeState (  INT  item_style = DefaultStyle  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns the state of the icon size: DefaultSize, SmallSize or LargeSize dependant from the given item_style item_style (see AbstractItemRenderer::ItemStyle). Per default DefaultSize is returned.

Reimplemented in DefaultItemRenderer.

virtual XYDIM AbstractItemRenderer::GetItemHeight (  INT  item_style = DefaultStyle  )  const [pure virtual]
 

Returns the height of an item in pixels dependant from the item_style (see AbstradtItemRenderer::ItemStyle).

Implemented in DefaultItemRenderer.

const ItemRendererProperties* AbstractItemRenderer::GetProperties (   )  const [inline]
 

BOOLEAN AbstractItemRenderer::ScrollText (   )  const [virtual]
 

Should be invoked after AbstractItemRenderer::StartTextScrolling each time the scroll-timer exceeds. The exceeding time of the scroll-timer is defined inside the animation-properties (see AbstractItemRenderer::GetProperties) in milliseconds.

Usually the implementation of this method just increases the internal scroll-position (e. g. mutable XYDIM m_scroll_pos), which will be initialized in AbstractItemRenderer::StartTextScrolling and used for the drawing in AbstractItemRenderer::DrawItem.

Returns:
TRUE, if the scrolling has been done. If FALSE is returned (e. g. when OnlyOnceAnimation is set), invoking this method does no further scrolling until AbstractItemRenderer::StartTextScrolling has been invoked before.

Reimplemented in DefaultItemRenderer.

void AbstractItemRenderer::SetProperties (  const ItemRendererProperties *  properties  )  [inline, protected]
 

BOOLEAN AbstractItemRenderer::StartTextScrolling (  const Item &  item,
const Rect &  bounds
)  const [virtual]
 

Should be invoked if the scrolling of the text should be started. Note that this method may not invoked if the animation-properties (see AbstractItemRenderer::GetProperties) define that the text should not be animated.

Usually the implementation of this method just has to initialize an internal scroll-position (e. g. mutable XYDIM m_scroll_pos), which will be increased in AbstractItemRenderer::ScrollText and used for the drawing in AbstractItemRenderer::DrawItem.

Parameters:
item Item whichs text should be scrolled.
bounds The bounding-rectangle where the drawing of the item must be done. It is not allowed to do any drawing outside this rectangle.
Returns:
TRUE, if the scrolling should be started and the scroll-timer should invoke AbstractItemRenderer::ScrollText after exceeding. Usually FALSE should be returned, if the text fits into the rectangle defined by bounds.

Reimplemented in AtlItemRenderer, and DefaultItemRenderer.

void AbstractItemRenderer::StopTextScrolling (  const Item &  item  )  const [virtual]
 

Should be invoked, if the scrolling of the text should be stopped.

Reimplemented in AtlItemRenderer, and DefaultItemRenderer.
